intro: Psathura borbonica var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psathura, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
